result.execSummary:
The defendant Douglas Raymond Kurvers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fin.Trans.Card-Fraud. Use >$5000-$10,000, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.41(5)(a)1a.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $13,000 restitution to be paid directly to KFH. Must maintain payment of $250/month, monitored thru probation. 10% surcharge to the District Attorney office and 5% surcharge to the Clerk of Circuit Court payable thru probation.

Must follow rules of supervision.
Must provide a DNA sample.  Under Wisconsin Statute 165.76, you are required to provide a biological specimen to the Wisconsin Department of Justice for deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) testing.  If you fail to provide a DNA sample, you may be held in contempt and subject to sanctions or charged with a new crime.

Not to be in possession of anyone else's banking information, documentation and/or bank cards without their permission.
Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored. If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.

$250.00 DNA surcharge to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan. Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts.

$290.60 fine/costs to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan. Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts.
May not possess or use firearms and, if considered a violent felony, no body armor.

timeConds.notes: Subject to work release, no good time.  Stayed.

10:17 AM Prosecuting attorney Benjamin James Webster in court specially for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Douglas Raymond Kurvers in court.  Attorney Arne Richard Skatrud in court for Douglas Raymond Kurvers. CW-clerk. 
Count 1-guilty plea. CT accepts plea, adj guilty & judgment entered. 
CT finds def waiving PSI

SENTENCE: w/h, probation up to 3 yrs. Restitution payable directly to KFH-$13,000, monitored thru probation. Plus 10% surcharge to DA office, 5% surcharge to COCC. CT will review if have made good faith effort toward payment. Follow rules of supervision. 4 days credit. 6 mo CT, subj to WR, no GT-stayed. Must maintain $250 to KFH. Must report to probation today. No poss of another person's financial cards/info.  DNA sample, $250 surcharge, $290.60 fine. 60 dtp or set pp, ftp-judgment. May not possess or use firearms and, if considered a violent felony, no body armor. Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored. If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights. PCR. 10:44 am adj.
